info.description:
Welcome to the Amazon AppFlow API reference. This guide is for developers who need detailed information about the Amazon AppFlow API operations, data types, and errors.

Amazon AppFlow is a fully managed integration service that enables you to securely transfer data between software as a service (SaaS) applications like Salesforce, Marketo, Slack, and ServiceNow, and Amazon Web Services like Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.

Use the following links to get started on the Amazon AppFlow API:

  • Actions: An alphabetical list of all Amazon AppFlow API operations.

  • Data types: An alphabetical list of all Amazon AppFlow data types.

  • Common parameters: Parameters that all Query operations can use.

  • Common errors: Client and server errors that all operations can return.

If you're new to Amazon AppFlow, we recommend that you review the Amazon AppFlow User Guide.

Amazon AppFlow API users can use vendor-specific mechanisms for OAuth, and include applicable OAuth attributes (such as auth-code and redirecturi) with the connector-specific ConnectorProfileProperties when creating a new connector profile using Amazon AppFlow API operations. For example, Salesforce users can refer to the Authorize Apps with OAuth documentation.
info.title: Amazon Appflow

servers.description: The Amazon Appflow endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The Amazon Appflow endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

post.description:
Returns a list of connector-profile details matching the provided connector-profile names and connector-types. Both input lists are optional, and you can use them to filter the result.

If no names or connector-types are provided, returns all connector profiles in a paginated form. If there is no match, this operation returns an empty list.

connectorType.description: The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Amplitude, and so on.

maxResults.description: Specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set. The default for maxResults is 20 (for all paginated API operations).

nextToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of data.

connectorProfileNames.description: The name of the connector profile. The name is unique for each ConnectorProfile in the Amazon Web Services account.

delete.description: Removes a tag from the specified flow.

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to untag.
parameters.name: resourceArn

parameters.description: The tag keys associated with the tag that you want to remove from your flow.
parameters.name: tagKeys

post.description: Provides details regarding the entity used with the connector, with a description of the data model for each entity.

connectorType.description: The type of connector application, such as Salesforce, Amplitude, and so on.

connectorProfileName.description: The name of the connector profile. The name is unique for each ConnectorProfile in the Amazon Web Services account.

connectorEntityName.description: The entity name for that connector.

post.description: Fetches the execution history of the flow.

maxResults.description: Specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set. The default for maxResults is 20 (for all paginated API operations).

nextToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of data.

flowName.description: The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

destinationFlowConfigList.description: The configuration that controls how Amazon AppFlow transfers data to the destination connector.

triggerConfig.description: The trigger settings that determine how and when Amazon AppFlow runs the specified flow.

allOf.description: Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow as defined by the user. Currently, these settings only apply to the Scheduled trigger type.
Specifies the type of flow trigger. This can be OnDemand, Scheduled, or Event.

sourceFlowConfig.description: Contains information about the configuration of the source connector used in the flow.

allOf.description: The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Amplitude, and so on.
The name of the connector profile. This name must be unique for each connector profile in the Amazon Web Services account.
Defines the configuration for a scheduled incremental data pull. If a valid configuration is provided, the fields specified in the configuration are used when querying for the incremental data pull.
Specifies the information that is required to query a particular source connector.

flowName.description: The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

tasks.description: A list of tasks that Amazon AppFlow performs while transferring the data in the flow run.

post.description: Creates a new connector profile associated with your Amazon Web Services account. There is a soft quota of 100 connector profiles per Amazon Web Services account. If you need more connector profiles than this quota allows, you can submit a request to the Amazon AppFlow team through the Amazon AppFlow support channel.

connectorType.description: The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Amplitude, and so on.

connectorProfileConfig.description: Defines the connector-specific configuration and credentials for the connector profile.

allOf.description: The connector-specific credentials required by each connector.
The connector-specific properties of the profile configuration.

connectionMode.description: Indicates the connection mode and specifies whether it is public or private. Private flows use Amazon Web Services PrivateLink to route data over Amazon Web Services infrastructure without exposing it to the public internet.

connectorProfileName.description: The name of the connector profile. The name is unique for each ConnectorProfile in your Amazon Web Services account.

kmsArn.description: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Key Management Service (KMS) key you provide for encryption. This is required if you do not want to use the Amazon AppFlow-managed KMS key. If you don't provide anything here, Amazon AppFlow uses the Amazon AppFlow-managed KMS key.

post.description: Deactivates the existing flow. For on-demand flows, this operation returns an unsupportedOperationException error message. For schedule and event-triggered flows, this operation deactivates the flow.

flowName.description: The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

post.description: Enables you to delete an existing connector profile.

forceDelete.description: Indicates whether Amazon AppFlow should delete the profile, even if it is currently in use in one or more flows.

connectorProfileName.description: The name of the connector profile. The name is unique for each ConnectorProfile in your account.

post.description: Describes the connectors vended by Amazon AppFlow for specified connector types. If you don't specify a connector type, this operation describes all connectors vended by Amazon AppFlow. If there are more connectors than can be returned in one page, the response contains a nextToken object, which can be be passed in to the next call to the DescribeConnectors API operation to retrieve the next page.

connectorTypes.description: The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Amplitude, and so on.

nextToken.description: The pagination token for the next page of data.

post.description: Returns the list of available connector entities supported by Amazon AppFlow. For example, you can query Salesforce for Account and Opportunity entities, or query ServiceNow for the Incident entity.

connectorType.description: The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Amplitude, and so on.

connectorProfileName.description: The name of the connector profile. The name is unique for each ConnectorProfile in the Amazon Web Services account, and is used to query the downstream connector.

entitiesPath.description: This optional parameter is specific to connector implementation. Some connectors support multiple levels or categories of entities. You can find out the list of roots for such providers by sending a request without the entitiesPath parameter. If the connector supports entities at different roots, this initial request returns the list of roots. Otherwise, this request returns all entities supported by the provider.

get.description: Retrieves the tags that are associated with a specified flow.

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified flow.
parameters.name: resourceArn

post.description: Applies a tag to the specified flow.

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to tag.
parameters.name: resourceArn

tags.description: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for your flow.

post.description: Enables your application to delete an existing flow. Before deleting the flow, Amazon AppFlow validates the request by checking the flow configuration and status. You can delete flows one at a time.

forceDelete.description: Indicates whether Amazon AppFlow should delete the flow, even if it is currently in use.

flowName.description: The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

post.description: Activates an existing flow. For on-demand flows, this operation runs the flow immediately. For schedule and event-triggered flows, this operation activates the flow.

flowName.description: The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

post.description: Enables your application to create a new flow using Amazon AppFlow. You must create a connector profile before calling this API. Please note that the Request Syntax below shows syntax for multiple destinations, however, you can only transfer data to one item in this list at a time. Amazon AppFlow does not currently support flows to multiple destinations at once.

destinationFlowConfigList.description: The configuration that controls how Amazon AppFlow places data in the destination connector.

triggerConfig.description: The trigger settings that determine how and when Amazon AppFlow runs the specified flow.

allOf.description: Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow as defined by the user. Currently, these settings only apply to the Scheduled trigger type.
Specifies the type of flow trigger. This can be OnDemand, Scheduled, or Event.

ConnectorProfile.description: Describes an instance of a connector. This includes the provided name, credentials ARN, connection-mode, and so on. To keep the API intuitive and extensible, the fields that are common to all types of connector profiles are explicitly specified at the top level. The rest of the connector-specific properties are available via the connectorProfileProperties field.

allOf.description: Specifies when the connector profile was created.
The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Amplitude, and so on.
Specifies the private connection provisioning state.
Indicates the connection mode and if it is public or private.
The name of the connector profile. The name is unique for each ConnectorProfile in the Amazon Web Services account.
Specifies when the connector profile was last updated.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector profile.
The connector-specific properties of the profile configuration.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector profile credentials.

ErrorHandlingConfig.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.

allOf.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.
Specifies the Amazon S3 bucket prefix.
Specifies if the flow should fail after the first instance of a failure when attempting to place data in the destination.

ServiceNowMetadata.description: The connector metadata specific to ServiceNow.

TrendmicroConnectorProfileCredentials.description: The connector-specific profile credentials required when using Trend Micro.

allOf.description: The Secret Access Key portion of the credentials.

VeevaMetadata.description: The connector metadata specific to Veeva.

SnowflakeConnectorProfileProperties.description: The connector-specific profile properties required when using Snowflake.

allOf.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket associated with Snowflake.
The Snowflake Private Link service name to be used for private data transfers.
The name of the Amazon S3 stage that was created while setting up an Amazon S3 stage in the Snowflake account. This is written in the following format: < Database>< Schema><Stage Name>.
The name of the account.
The bucket path that refers to the Amazon S3 bucket associated with Snowflake.
The name of the Snowflake warehouse.
The Amazon Web Services Region of the Snowflake account.

GoogleAnalyticsSourceProperties.description: The properties that are applied when Google Analytics is being used as a source.

allOf.description: The object specified in the Google Analytics flow source.

WriteOperationType.description: The possible write operations in the destination connector. When this value is not provided, this defaults to the INSERT operation.

ScheduledTriggerProperties.description: Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow as defined by the user. Currently, these settings only apply to the Scheduled trigger type.

allOf.description: Specifies the optional offset that is added to the time interval for a schedule-triggered flow.
The scheduling expression that determines the rate at which the schedule will run, for example rate(5minutes).
Specifies the time zone used when referring to the date and time of a scheduled-triggered flow, such as America/New_York.
Specifies whether a scheduled flow has an incremental data transfer or a complete data transfer for each flow run.
Specifies the date range for the records to import from the connector in the first flow run.
Specifies the scheduled start time for a schedule-triggered flow.
Specifies the scheduled end time for a schedule-triggered flow.

Specifies if PrivateLink is enabled for that connector.

DatadogConnectorProfileCredentials.description: The connector-specific credentials required by Datadog.

allOf.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier used to authenticate a user, developer, or calling program to your API.

Application keys, in conjunction with your API key, give you full access to Datadogs programmatic API. Application keys are associated with the user account that created them. The application key is used to log all requests made to the API.

TriggerConfig.description: The trigger settings that determine how and when Amazon AppFlow runs the specified flow.

allOf.description: Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow as defined by the user. Currently, these settings only apply to the Scheduled trigger type.
Specifies the type of flow trigger. This can be OnDemand, Scheduled, or Event.

RedshiftDestinationProperties.description: The properties that are applied when Amazon Redshift is being used as a destination.

allOf.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the Amazon Redshift destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.
The intermediate bucket that Amazon AppFlow uses when moving data into Amazon Redshift.
The object key for the bucket in which Amazon AppFlow places the destination files.
The object specified in the Amazon Redshift flow destination.

PrefixConfig.description: Determines the prefix that Amazon AppFlow applies to the destination folder name. You can name your destination folders according to the flow frequency and date.

allOf.description: Determines the level of granularity that's included in the prefix.
Determines the format of the prefix, and whether it applies to the file name, file path, or both.

DynatraceConnectorProfileProperties.description: The connector-specific profile properties required by Dynatrace.

allOf.description: The location of the Dynatrace resource.

HoneycodeConnectorProfileProperties.description: The connector-specific properties required when using Amazon Honeycode.

allOf.description: The configuration that controls how Amazon AppFlow places data in the destination connector.
The trigger settings that determine how and when the flow runs.
The configuration that controls how Amazon AppFlow retrieves data from the source connector.

The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Key Management Service (KMS) key you provide for encryption. This is required if you do not want to use the Amazon AppFlow-managed KMS key. If you don't provide anything here, Amazon AppFlow uses the Amazon AppFlow-managed KMS key.
A description of the flow you want to create.
The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.
A list of tasks that Amazon AppFlow performs while transferring the data in the flow run.
The tags used to organize, track, or control access for your flow.
Indicates whether Amazon AppFlow should delete the profile, even if it is currently in use in one or more flows.
The name of the connector profile. The name is unique for each ConnectorProfile in your account.

AmplitudeConnectorProfileCredentials.description: The connector-specific credentials required when using Amplitude.

allOf.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier used to authenticate a user, developer, or calling program to your API.
The Secret Access Key portion of the credentials.
The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

GoogleAnalyticsConnectorProfileCredentia.description: The connector-specific profile credentials required by Google Analytics.

allOf.description: The identifier for the desired client.
The OAuth requirement needed to request security tokens from the connector endpoint.
The client secret used by the OAuth client to authenticate to the authorization server.
The credentials used to access protected Google Analytics resources.
The credentials used to acquire new access tokens. This is required only for OAuth2 access tokens, and is not required for OAuth1 access tokens.

DatadogConnectorProfileProperties.description: The connector-specific profile properties required by Datadog.

allOf.description: The location of the Datadog resource.

GoogleAnalyticsConnectorProfilePropertie.description: The connector-specific profile properties required by Google Analytics.

ZendeskConnectorProfileProperties.description: The connector-specific profile properties required when using Zendesk.

allOf.description: The location of the Zendesk resource.
Returns information about the connector profiles associated with the flow.
The pagination token for the next page of data. If nextToken=null, this means that all records have been fetched.

UpsolverS3OutputFormatConfig.description: The configuration that determines how Amazon AppFlow formats the flow output data when Upsolver is used as the destination.

allOf.description: Indicates the file type that Amazon AppFlow places in the Upsolver Amazon S3 bucket.

SupportedFieldTypeDetails.description: Contains details regarding all the supported FieldTypes and their corresponding filterOperators and supportedValues.

allOf.description: The initial supported version for fieldType. If this is later changed to a different version, v2 will be introduced.
The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.
Returns the internal execution ID of an on-demand flow when the flow is started. For scheduled or event-triggered flows, this value is null.
The flow's Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
Indicates the current status of the flow.

ConnectorEntityField.description: Describes the data model of a connector field. For example, for an account entity, the fields would be account name, account ID, and so on.

allOf.description: The unique identifier of the connector field.
The properties that can be applied to a field when the connector is being used as a source.
The properties applied to a field when the connector is being used as a destination.
Contains details regarding the supported FieldType, including the corresponding filterOperators and supportedValues.
A description of the connector entity field.
The label applied to a connector entity field.
Indicates the current status of the flow.

DatadogSourceProperties.description: The properties that are applied when Datadog is being used as a source.

allOf.description: The object specified in the Datadog flow source.
Specifies the user name of the account that performed the most recent update.
The configuration that controls how Amazon AppFlow transfers data to the destination connector.
The trigger settings that determine how and when the flow runs.
Specifies when the flow was last updated.
The configuration that controls how Amazon AppFlow retrieves data from the source connector.

The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the Key Management Service (KMS) key you provide for encryption. This is required if you do not want to use the Amazon AppFlow-managed KMS key. If you don't provide anything here, Amazon AppFlow uses the Amazon AppFlow-managed KMS key.
A description of the flow.
Contains an error message if the flow status is in a suspended or error state. This applies only to scheduled or event-triggered flows.
The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.
The tags used to organize, track, or control access for your flow.
Specifies when the flow was created.
The flow's Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
The ARN of the user who created the flow.
Describes the details of the most recent flow run.
Indicates the current status of the flow.
A list of tasks that Amazon AppFlow performs while transferring the data in the flow run.
Defines the connector-specific profile configuration and credentials.
Indicates the connection mode and if it is public or private.
The name of the connector profile and is unique for each ConnectorProfile in the Amazon Web Services account.

HoneycodeConnectorProfileCredentials.description: The connector-specific credentials required when using Amazon Honeycode.

allOf.description: The credentials used to access protected Amazon Honeycode resources.
The credentials used to acquire new access tokens.

SourceConnectorProperties.description: Specifies the information that is required to query a particular connector.

allOf.description: Specifies the information that is required for querying Amplitude.
Specifies the information that is required for querying Amazon S3.
Specifies the information that is required for querying Google Analytics.
Specifies the information that is required for querying ServiceNow.
Specifies the information that is required for querying Veeva.
Specifies the information that is required for querying Trend Micro.

Specifies the information that is required for querying Infor Nexus.

SalesforceSourceProperties.description: The properties that are applied when Salesforce is being used as a source.

allOf.description: Indicates whether Amazon AppFlow includes deleted files in the flow run.
The flag that enables dynamic fetching of new (recently added) fields in the Salesforce objects while running a flow.
The object specified in the Salesforce flow source.

BasicAuthCredentials.description: The basic auth credentials required for basic authentication.

allOf.description: The password to use to connect to a resource.
The username to use to connect to a resource.

EventBridgeMetadata.description: The connector metadata specific to Amazon EventBridge.

PrivateConnectionProvisioningState.description: Specifies the private connection provisioning state.

allOf.description: Specifies the private connection provisioning failure cause.
Specifies the private connection provisioning failure reason.
Specifies the private connection provisioning status.
The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

CustomerProfilesMetadata.description: The connector metadata specific to Amazon Connect Customer Profiles.

ConnectorEntity.description: The high-level entity that can be queried in Amazon AppFlow. For example, a Salesforce entity might be an Account or Opportunity, whereas a ServiceNow entity might be an Incident.

allOf.description: The name of the connector entity.
The label applied to the connector entity.

Specifies whether the connector entity is a parent or a category and has more entities nested underneath it. If another call is made with entitiesPath = "the_current_entity_name_with_hasNestedEntities_true", then it returns the nested entities underneath it. This provides a way to retrieve all supported entities in a recursive fashion.

Task.description: A class for modeling different type of tasks. Task implementation varies based on the TaskType.

allOf.description: A map used to store task-related information. The execution service looks for particular information based on the TaskType.
The source fields to which a particular task is applied.
Specifies the particular task implementation that Amazon AppFlow performs.
The operation to be performed on the provided source fields.
A field in a destination connector, or a field value against which Amazon AppFlow validates a source field.

VeevaConnectorProfileProperties.description: The connector-specific profile properties required when using Veeva.

allOf.description: The location of the Veeva resource.
The response of ListConnectorEntities lists entities grouped by category. This map's key represents the group name, and its value contains the list of entities belonging to that group.

AggregationConfig.description: The aggregation settings that you can use to customize the output format of your flow data.

allOf.description: Specifies whether Amazon AppFlow aggregates the flow records into a single file, or leave them unaggregated.

ErrorInfo.description: Provides details in the event of a failed flow, including the failure count and the related error messages.

allOf.description: Specifies the error message that appears if a flow fails.
Specifies the failure count for the attempted flow.

ExecutionResult.description: Specifies the end result of the flow run.

allOf.description: The total number of bytes written as a result of the flow run.
The number of records processed in the flow run.
Provides any error message information related to the flow run.
The total number of bytes processed by the flow run.
The configuration that is applied to the connectors used in the flow.
The pagination token for the next page of data.
Specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set. The default for maxResults is 20 (for all paginated API operations).
The pagination token for the next page of data.
The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

SnowflakeDestinationProperties.description: The properties that are applied when Snowflake is being used as a destination.

allOf.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the Snowflake destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.
The intermediate bucket that Amazon AppFlow uses when moving data into Snowflake.
The object key for the destination bucket in which Amazon AppFlow places the files.
The object specified in the Snowflake flow destination.

OAuthProperties.description: The OAuth properties required for OAuth type authentication.

allOf.description: The token url required to fetch access/refresh tokens using authorization code and also to refresh expired access token using refresh token.
The OAuth scopes required for OAuth type authentication.
The authorization code url required to redirect to SAP Login Page to fetch authorization code for OAuth type authentication.

SingularMetadata.description: The connector metadata specific to Singular.

SalesforceDestinationProperties.description: The properties that are applied when Salesforce is being used as a destination.

allOf.description: The settings that determine how Amazon AppFlow handles an error when placing data in the Salesforce destination. For example, this setting would determine if the flow should fail after one insertion error, or continue and attempt to insert every record regardless of the initial failure. ErrorHandlingConfig is a part of the destination connector details.
This specifies the type of write operation to be performed in Salesforce. When the value is UPSERT, then idFieldNames is required.
The name of the field that Amazon AppFlow uses as an ID when performing a write operation such as update or delete.
The object specified in the Salesforce flow destination.

FieldTypeDetails.description: Contains details regarding the supported field type and the operators that can be applied for filtering.

allOf.description: The list of operators supported by a field.
The list of values that a field can contain. For example, a Boolean fieldType can have two values: "true" and "false".
The type of field, such as string, integer, date, and so on.

allOf.description: The OAuth requirement needed to request security tokens from the connector endpoint.

The credentials used to acquire new access tokens.

allOf.description: The password that corresponds to the user name.

allOf.description: Determines the prefix that Amazon AppFlow applies to the folder name in the Amazon S3 bucket. You can name folders according to the flow frequency and date.
Indicates the file type that Amazon AppFlow places in the Amazon S3 bucket.
